meanings.definition: One who catches a brief or partial view of something.
meanings.sent1: The glimpsers at the zoo were excited to see the lion for a moment.
meanings.sent2: She caught a quick glimpse of the shooting star in the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The glimpsers at the magic show were amazed by the disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: As a glimpsing detective, he noticed the subtle clue that cracked the case.
meanings.sent5: The little girl was a skilled glimpsing artist, capturing fleeting moments in her drawings.

meanings.definition: A brief or incomplete view or look at something.
meanings.sent1: The hikers only had a brief glimpsing of the mountain peak through the fog.
meanings.sent2: He managed to get a quick glimpsing of the rare bird before it flew away.
meanings.sent3: The glimpsers at the crowded concert struggled to see the stage.
meanings.sent4: The old photo provided a nostalgic glimpsing into the past.
meanings.sent5: The glimpsing sunlight through the trees created a beautiful pattern on the forest floor.
